title: lmfao at that oce skin garbage
body:
so we get pool party ziggs for testing out their pos beta server they had that was filled completely with issues, we wait 2 years being told over and over again that it was on it's way with no actual progression being made during that time and now we're told we have to pay for it despite other release servers getting their region skin for FREE and not having to be part of some bs beta server? 

Is everyone going to ignore the fact Russia got 3 skins for free? Are people actually that stupid as to believe that because they say they are going to donate the money to charity that everything is suddenly fine? You do realise the only reason they even decided to do that was because they knew they were being stingy pricks charging people for a skin they were making out to be free. 

I'm fine donating money to charity, but really? Is it actually that hard to see why they did that? Keep it up riot, keep being a joke and making all the mistakes so another company can come in and know what not to do.

Now all you stupid retards that want to defend them may as well save your words if you even bothered to read this because i could not care less

replies.body:
I have many things I hate on Riot's account, but this time I am gonna stand with them on their side.

We already got a free Pool Party skin, which comes with a free champ for those who didn't have Ziggs at that point.

I can't see why we shouldn't be paying for this one, not to mention this skin would also be half priced for 2 weeks.

A half price for 2 skins, a free transfer, a free champ for some and way better ping? That's a wonderful trade if you ask me.

______________
________________

I don't have problems with people donating money to charity. My only concern is how the charity is gonna use it.

As long as they find the right route to do things (so it gets sent to people who are not biased and actually care), donating is a noble act.

The ping is less but honestly when I was on NA I played better at 200-300 ms than when I play in OCE with a 100 ms (100 ms is when it spikes) normally it is 39-45 ms. But in ranked games when you lagg at 1000 ping O.O
So riot is good in some things but they aren't being equal as the other servers got free skins.
Other servers got that plus more, i dont see why we shouldnt get the same

> [{quoted}](name=Autismo Extremo,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-09-29T08:37:58.299+0000)
>
> Other servers got that plus more, i dont see why we shouldnt get the same

Well I would guess it's potentially due to them not finishing the promised goodies when the server went live (which is yeah their fault ain't gonna dispute), resulting them having the capitals pulled out during the development (as it's no longer fresh and it's no longer relevant). 

Which imo is probably the reason why they took THIS long, as they tried to complete this thing, along with other arrangement such as the charity, on basically no budget and no allocated time slots to work on it (as they were placed on doing other OCE related events such as Ocean Week). So they had to basically pull everything by themselves, in off times essentially, hence the progress was immensely hindered and was only completed very recently.

But it's just an hypothesis of mine.

Tbh, as much as I would like to demand more as I value equality greatly. But considering we actually got the damn thing which had since been forgotten by everybody, I personally am willing to give it a free pass. It's not the full experience no doubt, but they have shown that they're willing to go this far to keep a promise and I'm cool with that.

Kinda like how a delivery man who took literally years to deliver a package, due to numerous extreme difficulties/hazards he had met during his way. When the goods did arrive, which everyone had clearly forgotten everything about the items and him, though the goods are evidently lacking, but personally I ain't gonna complain too much and instead Imma praise him for him keeping his promise even after all this time.

**But I guess I'm just reading too much in this case. I just don't feel like hating them on this one, dunno why.**

Players: What skin what are you talking about? I don't care, old news.

Riot: We finally settled on an idea which represent OCE. Look at the splash art for your server skin. 

Players: OMFG!!! WE'VE BEEN WAITING SO LONG AND I SWEAR WE ARENT ONLY COMPLAINING BECAUSE YOU MENTIONED IT. 

Like yeah.... We totally didn't forget and stop caring.
It's not like this is an opportunity to hate speech because we like to bitch about anything. Nope. 


------
Players summed up in a nutshell.

+1 I think it's bullshit how every other server gets a skin for free, but because we've already received a skin for free, which I might add, nobody fucking wanted and a lot of people already had, we must pay for our own server skin. We've waited over 2 years for this and now all of a sudden it's sprung on us that we must pay. Sure, it's a nice gesture that a percentage of the money is donated to charity... that's not my issue. This issue is we've waited years for it and all of a sudden we must pay because we've already received a skin for free. I think it's complete fuckery.

Once again Riot, you continue to impress us with how utterly stupid you can be. I'd rather trade in the skin we've already been given for this one, at least this is unique and has some significance.
tbh i'd rather pay for 50% normal price for our regional skin along with a free Pool Party Ziggs than play every f*cking game on 250 ping.

I like that Riot is going to give the money to charity.. But Riot should really start to consider how much OCE has been jerked around ever since the server opened. If this skin is indeed going to be the OCE themed skin for OCE server then it should be free for everyone on OCE and every other region that buys the skin - those proceeds can go charity if Riot are so insistent on donating to charity.
We've waited two years and the best we are getting is a 2 week 50% off bonus? That is absurd.

So we wait over two years and when we finally get some news from Riot that we're getting an OCE skin we have to pay for it? Meanwhile other regions got theirs for free, their excuse is for charity? Sorry but that's bullcrap and everyone knows it, I'm all for charity but this is bullshit, if other regions got their stuff for free why cant we? They have over a billion dollars if they want to give to charity they can do just that they don't need to shit on our region to do it, this is all just to make themselves look better.

And there are people out there that actually defend Riot, i bet people are just gonna be like "BUT CHARITY", pathetic, Riot is a terrible company and this just proves it, I'm not buying that skin based on principle alone, sorry to the charity that wont be getting the money.

Honestly it's the same thing as Chroma skins, it's money grabbing by a lazy company.

Personally i'd much prefer to give money to a charity of my choice instead of giving money to a charity that i have no choice in, and getting a skin that we honestly should be getting for free.

And for those that will argue that they aren't money grabbing, fact is that they are only giving the funds from OCE, meaning any other server that buys our skin's money goes to riot.

there's a few reason why they're doing this which they won't admit:

1. oce is small in comparison to other regions so they want to make it more profitable as you can assume they make the least money here at the moment.
2. just like with everything else in australia, especially video games (hi steam), they will charge more/not make things free because THEY KNOW we will pay for it.

What most people tend to forget is that riot is not making money out of this from the first two weeks (which is generally when everyone is going to get it).

Enough of this $$$$ bullshit

I'd rather donate money this way than give it to someone asking on the street.
at least I know I'm getting something out of it.
but yeah it is pretty stinge.

> [{quoted}](name=Alfawarrior3,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-09-29T07:41:44.264+0000)
>
> I'd rather donate money this way than give it to someone asking on the street.
> at least I know I'm getting something out of it.
> but yeah it is pretty stinge.

I'm gotta be that guy and say that,

Giving money to someone on the street is actually a better spent than giving it to charity sometimes.

Because you effectively skip all the unnecessary procedures in the middle which drains your money, and reach directly to the client. And you get to see the effect in person.

The only problem is how they would spend the cash they received. Some spend it on getting better, some would spend on more alcohols, it's pretty much the only downside of this method.

Also here, I am excluding things like the beggars' sects or other similar organisations. But that's not saying they're bad.

While some beggars might spend the money on bettering themselves, the actual problem is that by being there on the street smelling of urine and stale mcdonalds and (speaking from experience, when they have decided they have had enough of a milkshake from mcdonalds, just throwing it out into the street regardless of where it lands, i saw a bunch of tourists get showered) it does decrease money made from tourism, a lot more revenue is lost for the country by them being there than they make for it by collecting your unwanted change. During the Rugby world cup in Auckland the police went and removed all of them from the central city so as not to offend the visiting countries. 

so by giving homeless money, you encourage them to just sit there and do nothing, (because if you can sit there and do nothing instead of working then why not) and by encouraging them to do that you are increasing the problem and thus contributing to the loss of revenue for your country. 

where as giving to a charity while you are dead right about so little of your money actually getting to the end, at least you arent losing money for the country.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2015-09-29T09:11:43.921+0000)
>
> so by giving homeless money, you encourage them to just sit there and do nothing, (because if you can sit there and do nothing instead of working then why not) and by encouraging them to do that you are increasing the problem and thus contributing to the loss of revenue for your country. 

That is imo wrong. Because being poor is an economic condition (well, capitalism what you gonna do about it), and not of character. If today it wasn't him sitting there, then it would be someone else, it's simply an endless vicious cycle.

That's why if you don't mind, giving some of your change to the poor isn't a bad thing, as long as you can afford it and ofc, feel like it.

The next step would be somehow educating them to use their money effectively for their own situation, which I hope there are government/organisation that actually cares enough to do so. Most of them spend their money for crap and behave like idiots because they really have no idea about literally anything, it's really not surprising to notice that most of them do in fact not have any substantial education background, nor was their experience with parents reasonably fair a lot of times.

It really isn't just an issue of "dem poor people and their unsightly look/attitude", but rather they are byproducts of many big issues that are going on, and only fixing those issues can truly deal with the beggar/poor problems.

I agree Sekai. I donate money to a charity that helps homeless veterans. One guy lost his right leg from an IED, ended up with PTSD, lost his family, his home, everything in the divorce. Now he lives in a tent wherever he can before people move him on.

Things are different in NZ we don't have veretans on the streets here, the homeless on queen St are just uneducated.
in my opinion no veterans should ever have to be homeless!

I wish they were different in Australia. Instead of looking after veterans who are disabled and impaired, lettting many live on the street we bring in immigrants and pay them more than we give those who serve our country.

> [{quoted}](name=Beer8Tacos,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=0002000000010000000100000000,timestamp=2015-09-30T04:37:30.113+0000)
>
> I wish they were different in Australia. Instead of looking after veterans who are disabled and impaired, lettting many live on the street we bring in immigrants and pay them more than we give those who serve our country.

Depends on what type of immigrants you're talking about.

For example the overseas students (who might be immigrants), who in some cases they are actually taking way more out of their pocket for the same thing Australians are buying. Such as education for one, averagely (or so I heard) they are paying 4 times the fees local kids are paying. Then there are bus tickets, health care etc.

But then you have refugees, I mean sure, they definitely suffer a lot back in their homes and the trip across sea must have been detrimental. But sometimes I just think a country should take priorities. In this case between homeless veterans and refugees, I think the country should fix the former's problems before attempting the latter. Getting your hands twisted from doing too many things at once is never good.

I am not saying to just kick the refugees back, because that's just not cool from both moral and economical point of view. However I think, just a thought that after they're settled down with basic equipments, the gov should come back and do some proper house cleaning before going out to invite people in.

Not sure if I'd get bombed for saying this tho.

I agree. I am not saying don't support refugees; just don't provide refugees with more than what we provide our own citizens.

Personally I'd like to see the money we provide to refugees, in the form of rental assistance and other benefits, in the same vein as a university HECS loan. Soon as you start to earn money you start to pay it back.

Being poor is an economic condition, but sitting there doing nothing about it is a character one, its not right to encourage a money for nothing mentality.

if you didn't ever give them change they wouldn't be sitting there at all, they would be out there doing something productive to earn it.

its because they know they get free money for just sitting there that they don't actively try to make their own.

im not saying they are wrong or its their fault that they are homeless, I'm saying that we should be encouraging people to earn money rather than encouraging able-bodied people to just accept handouts. there are too many people who abuse the doll system too, its there to help people who cant get a job, not to provide an out for those people who can but just don't want to.

besides the money they make by sitting there isn't enough to accomplish anything, its enough for a value meal a day at burger king and to fuel their drug or alcohol habits that probably landed them there in the first place. 
they need help not handouts.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=00020000000100000000,timestamp=2015-09-29T09:52:08.730+0000)
>
> Being poor is an economic condition, but sitting there doing nothing about it is a character one, its not right to encourage a money for nothing mentality.

No job is gonna hire them given their circumstance, and lots of them are not educated enough to know shiet for anything.

Some tries, you see that quite a bit here in Sydney (especially in the city), but I don't think they actually earn more. And their performance/effort of trying to earn cash is mostly mediocre due to their lack of polish in that particular field, which again, is directed back at their initial lack of money.
 
> im not saying they are wrong or its their fault that they are homeless, I'm saying that we should be encouraging people to earn money rather than encouraging able-bodied people to just accept handouts.
>
> they need help not handouts.

I agree that money needs to be earned and I am 100% with you on saying that they need help and not just some coins.

But realistically, they just don't get either of those things atm because,

1. They are generally not well funded enough to really know shiet, and
2. No one is really bothered enough to actually teach them fishing, as well as taking capitalism a step forward so this issue would actually disappear.

An average joe like you and me, we can only delay their inevitable fall into poison abuse and other short comings by giving them some hope through the form of spare changes.

It's not much, but it's pretty much what we can only do now.

EDIT: As an add-on, not everyone can just go and do other pure muscle jobs when they don't have money or educational background, considering job saturation and availability is a thing.

EDIT2: I also do know that in Aus poor people get gov funds, but it's essentially just a bigger coin pack, it's not gonna change things all that much. But hey I guess it's something. Still an attempt to fix the root of it would be nice.

Yes i see exactly where you are coming from, perhaps I'm just a little harsh because i walk past them every day on my way to uni and have multiple times had them throwing globs of spit and other things at me and other bystanders, you see them urinating on the wall literally 30 cm from the atm machine (and this is in Queen St, the centre of Auckalnd, NZ's version of times square) this lack in decency is what annoys me, i know they are not educated, but no one who has lived their whole life in NZ doesn't know that Urinating on the wall on the busiest St in the country isn't socially acceptable.

I am more likely to give money to those who do perform however, even if its not very good it shows that they understand that in order to get something, you need to do something in return (equivalent exchange if you watch FMA) and i respect that effort greatly. 
Using they money they earned by begging to buy a harmonica or something and even if they just blow haphazardly into it, it shows that they have the will to climb out of their situation, and are not content to just sit and accept handouts. these are the people who deserve the be helped out.
in my opinion of course 

but yea you are right

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-09-29T07:56:53.042+0000)
>
> I'm gotta be that guy and say that,
> 
> Giving money to someone on the street is actually a better spent than giving it to charity sometimes.
> 
> Because you effectively skip all the unnecessary procedures in the middle which drains your money, and reach directly to the client. And you get to see the effect in person.
> 
> The only problem is how they would spend the cash they received. Some spend it on getting better, some would spend on more alcohols, it's pretty much the only downside of this method.
> 
> Also here, I am excluding things like the beggars' sects or other similar organisations. But that's not saying they're bad.

I meant the people that walk around with their clipboard and are all "do you want to give money to save the orangutans" and stuff.

> [{quoted}](name=Alfawarrior3,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TmshA96O,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-09-29T08:09:36.110+0000)
>
> I meant the people that walk around with their clipboard and are all "do you want to give money to save the orangutans" and stuff.

Oh my bad, then I understand, I no like them too.

Russia has the craziest white people. Maybe riot didnt want to piss them off.

Aussies dont know how to fire up properly. Shit goes down here we post to forums with angry emoticons. In france they burn buildings and turn over cars.

Just relax mate and put a smiley face in the post.

http://i.imgur.com/tbcrGRq.jpg

after all this time

i really dont care anymore more lmao

Yeah riot, we should get this skin for free, lik what?  We wait 2 years for a skin we have to pay for?
You say it took you 2 years to work on it, you forgot about it for a year then it takes you a whole year for a skin which all other servers get for free, then you want to charge us? 
Get real, Riot

Of course they could not give us a skin at all, we should be grateful that they gave us a skin (and a cool one at that) at all, considering that they did give us a free skin and champ on release of the server. which means we get a free skin + champ AND a half price skin.
